page.title: 12BEVERTON FARM
page.content:
When he used to farm he would get up early but now he will stay in bed until about 7.30am because as he said he had not much to do. He has no animals left now except a few bantams which he keeps for the eggs. He used to keep cattle but these all went when he sold most of the land. He has no fresh milk but buys dried, skimmed milk in the shops in Wiveliscombe.
He talked of the change in schooling, he used to walk to Clatworthy school which was about three miles away when he was a boy walking through long muddy lanes. Now children are taken out by car or school bus to Wiveliscombe or Minehead.
